tool_description: The Mozscape API allows you to customize and integrate data from our dynamic Mozscape index right into your own applications. Our Mozscape index is updated frequently to ensure that you're getting the freshest look at the web possible. With billions of links in our index, intelligent metrics, and thorough URL data, our Mozscape API offers unlimited possibilities.
name: Moz
title: Moz

api_list.name: url-metrics
api_list.description: The url-metrics Mozscape endpoint returns metrics for a URL or set of URLs you specify. Use the Cols parameter to specify which metrics to return; enter the sum of the bit flag values for each metric.  For a single URL, use a GET request—the typical Mozscape format, with all information contained in the body of a single URL. Use batched calls for more than one URL.  Response fields help you organize the information Mozscape returns.

required_parameters.name: target_url
required_parameters.description: The URL for the link you want to analyze.

optional_parameters.name: Cols
optional_parameters.description: Specifies which URL metrics to retrieve for a target URL.

optional_parameters.name: SourceCols
optional_parameters.description: Specifies which URL metrics to retrieve for the source URL of a link. Only links calls use this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: TargetCols
optional_parameters.description: Specifies which URL metrics to retrieve for the target URL of a link. Only links calls use this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: LinkCols
optional_parameters.description: Specifies which link metrics to retrieve for a link. Only links calls use this parameter.

optional_parameters.name: Limit
optional_parameters.description: Specifies a maximum number of results to return for a call.  Limit ensures the results of an API call are easy for your application to handle and helps ensure timely API responses when you submit a query for a target URL with many potential source URLs. (Returning large amounts of data can cause Mozscape to time out.)  The default value for Limit is 25. The maximum value is 50.

optional_parameters.name: Offset
optional_parameters.description: Specifies a number of results to skip past.  Offset helps when making multiple Mozscape calls for information about the same URL or URLs. For example, to find all source URLs pointing to moz.com (a number in the thousands), make several calls with increasing Offset values until all results return.  The default value of Offset is 0. Offsets greater than 100,000 return an empty array. Offsets inclusive of a hundred-thousandth result return up to that result. (Mozscape offers a maximum of 100,000 results per URL.)

optional_parameters.name: Scope
optional_parameters.description: Scope narrows results by returning only certain kinds of links. For example, Scope can help you find all unique domains linking to a target URL you specify.  Use Scope for analyzing domain-level metrics. For example, a Mozscape call with Scope=domain_to_page&Limit=1&Sort=page_authority returns the unique domain with the highest page authority for the target URL. Only links and anchor-text calls accept Scope values. Each endpoint has its own set of possible values.

optional_parameters.name: Sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort orders results in descending order for a particular value. Only links, metadata, and top-pages endpoints accept Sort parameters.  Mozscape allows one Sort value per call. The default value of Sort is page_authority.

optional_parameters.name: Filter
optional_parameters.description: Filter excludes results for Mozscape calls that do not meet specified criteria. For example, followed links and equity links often affect search engine results more than other types of links, so it's useful to filter for equity links or only some types of equity links.  The links, anchor-text, and top-pages endpoints each accept different Filter values.  For links calls, Filter is additive: you can apply more than one filter to a query. Use the "plus" symbol + between criteria to specify more than one filter parameter. Filter is a true logical "and", meaning results return only if they meet all filter criteria.  For anchor-text and top-pages calls, Mozscape accepts only one Filter value.

api_list.name: metadata
api_list.description: Find index statistics and release dates with metadata.  Metadata is available to free and paid API users.

required_parameters.name: command
required_parameters.description: last_update (last_update.json)	Returns the date (in Unix Epoch format) of the last Mozscape Index update (In JSON).	(none) next_update (next_update.json)	Returns the date (in Unix Epoch format) of the next scheduled Mozscape Index update (In JSON).	(none) index_stats	Returns data about the volume of information in the Mozscape Index.	crawl_duration: Duration in days of the current index crawl length urls: Number of URLs fqdns: Number of fully-qualified domain names (subdomains) plds: Number of paid-level domains (root domains) links: Number of links crawled nofollow: Percentage of links with a nofollow attribute specified rel_canonical: Percentage of links with a canonical attribute specified links_per_page: Average number of links per page external_links_per_page: Average number of external links per page

optional_parameters.name: Sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort value	Description page_authority	Source URLs with the most Page Authority return first. domains_linking_page	The number of distinct root domains linking to a source URL.

api_list.name: anchor-text-metrics
api_list.description: The anchor-text endpoint returns anchor text for inbound links.

required_parameters.name: target_url
required_parameters.description: The URL for the link you want to analyze.

optional_parameters.name: Scope
optional_parameters.description: Mozscape allows one Scope per call. The default value of Scope for anchor-text is phrase_to_page.

optional_parameters.name: Filter
optional_parameters.description: Mozscape accepts only one Filter value for anchor-text calls.  The default value of Filter for anchor-text is external.

optional_parameters.name: Cols
optional_parameters.description: Cols

optional_parameters.name: SourceCols
optional_parameters.description: SourceCols

optional_parameters.name: Limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit

api_list.name: top-pages
api_list.description: The top-pages endpoint, accessible to Mozscape paid users, returns metrics for many URLs on a subdomain you specify.  Make top-pages calls with a GET request for a single subdomain and specify metrics to return with the Cols parameter.

required_parameters.name: target_url
required_parameters.description: The URL for the link you want to analyze.

optional_parameters.name: Sort
optional_parameters.description: You can Sort top-pages results by Page Authority (page_authority) or the number of distinct root domains linking to a source URL (domains_linking_page).  The default value of Sort for top-pages is page_authority.

optional_parameters.name: Limit
optional_parameters.description: A maximum of 50 records can be retrieved per call. Use Offset and Limit to retrieve a maximum of 100,000 total records.

optional_parameters.name: Offset
optional_parameters.description: A maximum of 50 records can be retrieved per call. Use Offset and Limit to retrieve a maximum of 100,000 total records.

optional_parameters.name: Filter
optional_parameters.description: Mozscape accepts only one Filter value for top-pages calls.  The default value of Filter for top-pages is all.

api_list.name: link-metrics
api_list.description: The links endpoint returns information about links between a target URL and other pages and domains. Parameters for links let you receive a wide array or a narrow subset of results, with multiple options for how results are sorted. Response fields help you organize the information Mozscape returns.

required_parameters.name: Scope
required_parameters.description: indicates which links to return based on whether the target and source URLs are pages, domains, or subdomains.

required_parameters.name: target_url
required_parameters.description: The URL for the link you want to analyze.

optional_parameters.name: Sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort links results by:  Page Authority (page_authority) Domain Authority (domain_authority) Number of unique root domains linking to the root domain (domains_linking_domain) Number of unique root domains linking to the page (domains_linking_page)

optional_parameters.name: Filter
optional_parameters.description: Filter excludes results unless they meet criteria you specify. You can specify more than one value by separating multiple Filter parameters with a plus symbol +.

optional_parameters.name: TargetCols
optional_parameters.description: TargetCols is a bit flag: a numerical value specifying which data to include about the target URL.

optional_parameters.name: SourceCols
optional_parameters.description: SourceCols is a bit flag: a numerical value specifying which data to include about source URLs that link to the target URL.

optional_parameters.name: LinkCols
optional_parameters.description: LinkCols is a bit flag: a numerical value specifying which data to include about the link itself (for example, if the link is nofollowed).
